full_text: Screened by NARA, 2/10/2023 OPIONAL FORM 230 (Epslish/Vietnamese) (Rev. 3 35. Have you ever app a visa to enter the United States? (If answer is Yes, state where and when, whether Yes No you applied for a nonimmigrant or an immigrant visa, and whether the visa was issued or refused). I_I (Co) (Khong) [Có bao giò duong-don nop don xin chieu-Khan nhap canh Hoa-Ky chua? (Neu có, xin cho biet 8 dau, bao gio, xin chieu-Khan nhap-cu hay vo nhap-cu, va CO duoc cap hay tu-Khuoc)] ave you been refused admission to the United States during the last 12 months? (If answer is Yes, explain) Yes No {Trong 12 thang qua CO bao gio duong don bi td-Khuo nhap-canh Hoa-Ky Khong? (Xin giai thich neu co) I_I (Có) (K(ohg) 37. Have you ever registered with a draft board under United States Selective Service Laws? (If answer is Yes, explain) Yes No [Có bao gi3 duong don dang Ky dau quân tai môt Hôi-Dong Tuyen M6 trong Khuon-Kho Luat Tuyen Binh (Co) (Khong) Hoa-Ky Khong? (Neu có xin giai-thich)] 38. Have you ever applied for relief from training and service in the United States Armed Forces or departed from Yes No or remained outside the United States to avoid or evade military service? (If answer is Yes, explain) (C6) (Khong) [Co' bao gi8 duong don xin mien tap va mien dich Voi quân-luc Hoa-Ky, roi Khoi, hay luu-tru ngoai lanh-tho Hoa-Ky nham tron-tranh nghia-vu quan-dich Khong? (Xin giai thich neu có)] 39. Do you intend to enter the United States from Canada, Mexico, or an island adjacent to the United States Yes No within 2 years after arrival in Canada, Mexico, or such adjacent island? (If answer is Yes, give the name of I_I (Co) (Khong) the transportation company by which you entered or intend to enter Canada, Maxico, or such island) [Dúong don có y dinh nhap-canh Hoa-Ky tuf Gia-Na-Dai, Mê-Tay-C8, hay mot dao não ke' can Hoa-Ky noi trong vong hai nam sau khi toi Gia-N-Dai, Me-Tay-C8 hay dao Ke' can nói tren Khong? (Neu co xin cho biet ten hang chuyen ch ma duong don da dung vao hay dinh vao Gia-Na-Dai, Mê-Tay-Co, hoac môt dao tuong-tu) 40. United States laws governing the issuance of visas require each applicant to state whether or not he or she is a member of any class of individusals excluded from admission into the United States. The excludable classes are described below. You should read carefully the following paragraphs; your understanding of their content and the answers you give the questions that follow will assist the consular officer to reach a decision on your eligibility to receive a visa. Phap luât Hoa-Ky quy-dinh viec cap phat chieu-Khan doi hoi moi duong don phai Khai TO minh CO thuoc vao hang nguoi bj loai-tru nhap- canh Hoa-Ky hay Khong? Nhung hang bi loai duoc mo-ta day. Duong-don nên doc Ky nhung doan sau day; su' thau-hieu va su tra 18i ro rang nhung cau hoi sau day se giup vien-chuc lanh-su duong su não co du tu-cach duoc cap chieu-Khan. EXCEPT AS OTHERWISE PROVIDED BY LAW, ALIENS WITHIN ANY OF THE FOLLOWING CLASSES ARE INELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE AN IMMIGRANT VISA: (NGOAI TRU NHUNG TRUONG HOP KHAC DO2 PHAP LUAT QUI-DIN NGOAI-KIEU, NAO THUOC CAC THAN) -PHAN SAU DAY KHONG HOI DU TU-CACH DE DUOC CAP CHIEU-KHAN NHAP-CU. (a) Aliens who are mentally retarded, insane, or who have suffered one or more attacks of insanity; aliens afflicted with psychopathic person- ality, sexual deviation, a mental defect, narcotic drug addicition, chronic alcoholism, or any dangerous contagious disease; aliens who have a physical defect, disease, or disability affecting their ability to earn a living; aliens who are paupers, professional beggars, or vagrants; aliens con- victed of a crime involving moral turpitude or who admit committing the essential elements of such a crime, or who have been sentenced to con- finement for at least 5 years in the aggregate for conviction of two or more crimes; aliens who are polygamists, or who practice or advocate polygamy; aliens who are prostitutes, or who have engaged in, benefited financially from, procured, or imported persons for the purpose of prostitution, or who seek entry to the United States to engage in prostitution or other commercialized vice, or any immoral sexual act; alines who seek entry to perform skilled or unskilled labor and who have not been certified by the Secretary of Labor; and aliens likely to become a public charge in the Untied States. (a) Ngoai-Kieu nao châm khon, mat tri hay da len con dien mot hay nhieu lan; ngoai-Kieu não mac các chung thai nhan-cach, tà dam loan-tri, nghien ma-tuy, nghien ruou kinh-nien, hay mac benh truyen nhiem nguy-hiem; ngoai-Kieu não Khong du suc muu sinh vi tan-phê, benh-hoan hay, CO tat; ngoai-Kieu não ban cung, lam nghe an xin hay vô gia-cu; ngoai kieu não bj ket-an vi toi phi-luan hay thu-nhan da vi-pham nhung yeu-tai chinh cua loai toi nay, hoac da bi ket an tu it nhat là nam nam ke chung hai hay nhieu lan bj toi; ngoai-kieu não CO nhieu v, nhieu chong, hay thuc-hanh hoac chu-truong che do da-thé, da-phu; ngoai-kieu nao hanh-nghê mai-dam hay da kiem tien bang nghe dan moi hoac hap-cáng gai nham viec mai dam, hay tim cach nhap-canh Hoa-Ky delam viec mai dam, hoac nhung tro buon ban toi-bai hay moi hanh-vi dam-duc phi-luân; ngoai-Kieu nao tim cach nhap canh de lam viec chuyen-mon hay khong chuyen-mon ma chua duoc giay BO Truong Lao-Dong chung-nhan, ngoai- Kieu não xet ra CO the tro-thanh ganh nang cho cong-quy Hoa-Ky. Do any of the foregoing classes apply to you? Yes No (If answer is Yes, explain) (Duong don co thuoc vao thanh-phan não noi tren Khong?) (Co) I__I (Khong) (Xin giai-thich ned có) (b) Aliens who seek re-entry within 1 year of their exclusion from the United States, or who, within the past 5 years, have been arrested and deported from the United States, or removed at Government expense in lieu of deportation, or removed as an alien in distress or as an alien enemy; aliens who procure or attempt to procure a visa or other documentation by fraud or willful misrepresentation; aliens who are not eligible to acquire United States citizenship, or who have departed from or remained outside the United States to avoid United States military service in time of war or national emergency; aliens who have been convicted for violating or for conspiring to violate certain laws or regulations relating to narcotic drugs or marihuana, or who are known or believed to be, or to have been, an illicit trafficker in narcotic drugs or marihuana; aliens seeking entry from foreign contiguous territory or adjacent islands within 2 years of their arrival therein on a non-signatory carrier; aliens who are unable to read and understand some language or dialect; aliens who, knowingly and for gain, have encouraged or assisted any other alien to enter,
